CapabilityUnavailable.description: The machine tool is not able to give a statement about the part quality.

Good.description: The part quality is determined good.

Bad.description: The part quality is determined bad.

NotYetMeasured.description: The PartQuality will still be determined in the machine tool to be either Good or Bad.

WillNotBeMeasured.description: The machine tool will not give a statement about the part quality.

CapabilityUnavailable.description: The machine tool is not able to give a statement about process irregularities.

Detected.description: A process irregularity has been detected.

NotDetected.description: There was no process irregularity detected.

NotYetDetermined.description: A statement about the process irregularity is to be expected.

NumberBased.description: The tool is addressed using a single identifier.

GroupBased.description: The tool is addressed using an identifier for the group and a second one for the tool within the group.

Other.description: The tool is addressed by a different, custom defined system.

Automatic.description: NC channel mode Automatic – execute CNC part programs.

MdaMdi.description: NC channel mode Mda/Mdi – manual data input and execution.

JogManual.description: NC channel mode Jog Manual – axis movement triggered by user.

JogIncrement.description: NC channel mode Jog Increment – incremental axis movement triggered by user.

TeachingHandle.description: NC channel mode Teaching Handle – teaching a machine tool by moving axes of the machine tool by hand.

Remote.description: NC channel mode Remote – the machine tool can receive CNC files via a remote access mechanism.

Reference.description: NC channel mode Reference – The machine tool returns to its reference point/ zero position.

Other.description: NC channel mode is different from the values defined in this enumeration.

Active.description: There is an active command being executed by the NC channel.

Interrupted.description: The NC execution is interrupted. Execution of a program in the channel can be restarted.

Reset.description: No NC command is active in the NC channel. E.g. channel is idle.

Undefined.description: The EDM spark generator state cannot be indicated.

Ready.description: Generator is initialized and can receive a set of technology parameters.

Active_Low_Voltage.description: Generator is switched on and is supplying pulses respecting the low voltage (≤ 25 V AC or ≤ 60 V DC) requirements of safety standard (ISO 28881).

Active_High_Voltage.description: Generator is switched on and is supplying pulse at high voltage (> 25 V AC or > 60 V DC).

Error.description: Generator is in an error state.

Undefined.description: The laser state cannot be indicated, for example because the device does not provide this information or because it is currently unavailable. This can be e.g. during the startup phase.

Ready.description: The laser is ready and laser programs can be started. No error state is active. In this state, laser emission is prohibited.

Active.description: In this state, safety clearances have to be set for processing and emission can be activated. For devices that can run programs themselves it indicates that a program is running on the laser device.

Error.description: An error state is reported from the laser device.

Manual.description: The machine tool is controlled manually, by the operator. Depending on technology specific norms, the maximum axis movement speeds of the machine tool are limited.

Automatic.description: Operating mode for the automatic, programmed and continuous operation of the machine. Manual loading and unloading workpieces are possible when the automatic program is stopped. Axis movement speeds are fully available to the machine tool’s ability.

Setup.description: Depending on technology specific norms, the maximum axis movement speeds of the machine tool are limited. In this mode, the operator can make settings for the subsequent work processes.

AutoWithManualIntervention.description: Operating mode with the possibility of manual interventions in the machining process as well as limited automatic operation started by the operator. Depending on technology specific norms, the maximum axis movement speeds of the machine tool are limited.

Service.description: Operating mode for service purposes. This mode shall not be used for manufacturing any parts. This mode shall only be used by authorized personnel.

Other.description: The machine operation mode is different from the values defined in this enumeration.

CapabilityUnavailable.description: The machine tool is not able to give a statement about the part quality.

Good.description: The part quality is determined good.

Bad.description: The part quality is determined bad.

NotYetMeasured.description: The PartQuality will still be determined in the machine tool to be either Good or Bad.

WillNotBeMeasured.description: The machine tool will not give a statement about the part quality.

CapabilityUnavailable.description: The machine tool is not able to give a statement about process irregularities.

Detected.description: A process irregularity has been detected.

NotDetected.description: There was no process irregularity detected.

NotYetDetermined.description: A statement about the process irregularity is to be expected.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type

EventId.description: The identifier for the event to comment.

Comment.description: The comment to add to the condition.

EventId.description: The identifier for the event to comment.

Comment.description: The comment to add to the condition.

EventId.description: The identifier for the event to comment.

Comment.description: The comment to add to the condition.

SubscriptionId.description: The identifier for the subscription to refresh.
The identifier for the subscription to refresh.

MonitoredItemId.description: The identifier for the monitored item to refresh.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

Location.description: To be used by end users to store the location of the machine in a scheme specific to the end user. Servers shall support at least 60 Unicode characters for the clients writing this value, this means clients can expect to be able to write strings with a length of 60 Unicode characters into that field.

ProductInstanceUri.description: A globally unique resource identifier provided by the manufacturer of the machine

AssetId.description: To be used by end users to store a unique identification in the context of their overall application. Servers shall support at least 40 Unicode characters for the clients writing this value, this means clients can expect to be able to write strings with a length of 40 Unicode characters into that field.

ComponentName.description: To be used by end users to store a human-readable localized text for the MachineryItem. The minimum number of locales supported for this property shall be two. Servers shall support at least 40 Unicode characters for the clients writing the text part of each locale, this means clients can expect to be able to write texts with a length of 40 Unicode characters into that field.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type.

DeviceClass.description: Indicates in which domain or for what purpose the MachineryItem is used.

HardwareRevision.description: A string representation of the revision level of the hardware of a MachineryItem. Hardware is physical equipment, as opposed to programs, procedures, rules and associated documentation. Many machines will not provide such information due to the modular and configurable nature of the machine.

InitialOperationDate.description: The date, when the MachineryItem was switched on the first time after it has left the manufacturer plant.

Manufacturer.description: A human-readable, localized name of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.

ManufacturerUri.description: A globally unique identifier of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.

Model.description: A human-readable, localized name of the model of the MachineryItem.

MonthOfConstruction.description: The month in which the manufacturing process of the MachineryItem has been completed. It shall be a number between 1 and 12, representing the month from January to December.

ProductCode.description: A machine-readable string of the model of the MachineryItem, that might include options like the hardware configuration of the model. This information might be provided by the ERP system of the vendor. For example, it can be used as order information.

ProductInstanceUri.description: A globally unique resource identifier provided by the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.

SerialNumber.description: A string containing a unique production number of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem. The global uniqueness of the serial number is only given in the context of the manufacturer, and potentially the model. The value shall not change during the life-cycle of the MachineryItem.

SoftwareRevision.description: A string representation of the revision level of a MachineryItem. In most cases, MachineryItems consist of several software components. In that case, information about the software components might be provided as additional information in the address space, including individual revision information. In that case, this property is either not provided or provides an overall software revision level. The value might change during the life-cycle of a MachineryItem.

YearOfConstruction.description: The year (Gregorian calendar) in which the manufacturing process of the MachineryItem has been completed. It shall be a four-digit number and never change during the life-cycle of a MachineryItem.

DefaultInstanceBrowseName.description: The default BrowseName for instances of the type

UIElement.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

data.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

StacklightOperationMode.description: Contains the values used to indicate how a stacklight (as a whole unit) is used.

Segmented.description: Stacklight is used as stack of individual lights

Levelmeter.description: Stacklight is used as level meter

Running_Light.description: The whole stack acts as a running light

Other.description: Stacklight is used in a way not defined in this version of the specification

StacklightMode.title: StacklightOperationMode
StacklightMode.description: Shows in what way (stack of individual lights, level meter, running light) the stacklight unit is used.

LevelDisplayMode.description: Contains the values used to indicate how a percentual value is displayed if the stacklight unit works in Levelmeter mode.

Other.description: Display fractions in a way not defined in this version of the specification.

DisplayMode.title: LevelDisplayMode
DisplayMode.description: Indicates in what way the percentual value is displayed with the stacklight.

LevelPercent.description: Shows the percentual value the stacklight is representing. The mandatory EURange Property of the Variable indicates the lowest and highest value and thereby allows to calculate the percentage represented by the value. The lowest value is interpreted as 0 percent, the highest is interpreted as 100 percent.

data.title: LevelDisplayMode
data.description: Indicates in what way the percentual value is displayed with the stacklight.

Shows the percentual value the stacklight is representing. The mandatory EURange Property of the Variable indicates the lowest and highest value and thereby allows to calculate the percentage represented by the value. The lowest value is interpreted as 0 percent, the highest is interpreted as 100 percent.
